metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11735 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The private-key operations in ecc.c in wolfSSL before 4.4.0 do not use a constant-time modular inverse when mapping to affine coordinates, aka a "projective coordinates leak."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl32 - 4.4.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0+dfsg-2').
